Offender owns up, gardeners visiting Northland ‘overwhelmed’ by crowdfunding and support https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/offender-owns-up-gardeners-visiting-northland-overwhelmed-by-crowdfunding-and-support/TLHS4HUG7ZGHHLOZ6YC3NOFNL4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/offender-owns-up-gardeners-visiting-northland-overwhelmed-by-crowdfunding-and-support/TLHS4HUG7ZGHHLOZ6YC3NOFNL4/ Sarah CurtisA Northland thief has owned up to stealing all a visiting gardening group's tools Wed, 08 Jan 2025 03:00:00 +0000 Community gardening group Whenua Warrior charitable trust has been "overwhelmed" by the level of public support since all its tools were stolen and two vehicles vandalised in Northland.

When horses were prohibited from using Gisborne’s new Peel St Bridge https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/when-horses-were-prohibited-from-using-gisbornes-new-peel-st-bridge/BLBM7SOZMRBYFBXMXTCJ5YLBG4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/when-horses-were-prohibited-from-using-gisbornes-new-peel-st-bridge/BLBM7SOZMRBYFBXMXTCJ5YLBG4/ Wynsley WrigleyGisborne's Peel Street Bridge marks 100 years of local history Wed, 08 Jan 2025 02:00:00 +0000 Gisborne's original Peel Street Bridge, built in 1881, is pictured in 1905. It was replaced by the existing bridge in 1923. Photo / Tairawhiti Museum William Crawford Collection
Gisborne company’s watermelons go on sale earlier than usual https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/gisborne-companys-watermelons-go-on-sale-earlier-than-usual/SP46ANSZYJDY3JGXG2U5LN6FXA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/gisborne-companys-watermelons-go-on-sale-earlier-than-usual/SP46ANSZYJDY3JGXG2U5LN6FXA/ 'We couldn’t have asked for more perfect weather in the early stages of our summer crops.' Wed, 08 Jan 2025 01:54:47 +0000 LeaderBrand general manager farming Gordon McPhail says the company is delighted to have watermelons in stores ahead of schedule, thanks to ideal growing conditions.

Wed, 08 Jan 2025 01:43:24 +0000 A man was shot in the coastal village of Mangōnui in the Far North overnight. Photo / Supplied
Pure Mama’s Lara Henderson and Bonnet’s Steph Kennard reflect on their successes https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/news/pure-mamas-lara-henderson-and-bonnets-steph-kennard-reflect-on-their-successes/WY7RJMGDJBG6VATVWCJFALGV7U/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/news/pure-mamas-lara-henderson-and-bonnets-steph-kennard-reflect-on-their-successes/WY7RJMGDJBG6VATVWCJFALGV7U/ Megan WilsonNew products and international expansion are on the cards for the two businesses. Gisborne’s 2024 weather in review: Niwa releases annual climate reporthttps://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/gisbornes-2024-weather-in-review-niwa-releases-annual-climate-report/63CHQSUQ4ZE7VMMHETRK6AP7RI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/gisbornes-2024-weather-in-review-niwa-releases-annual-climate-report/63CHQSUQ4ZE7VMMHETRK6AP7RI/ Murray RobertsonNiwa confirms December was the second wettest in Gisborne in 120 years. Wed, 08 Jan 2025 01:27:49 +0000 The heavy rain on Boxing Day and heavy flow in the rivers left another layer of driftwood and debris on Gisborne's beaches in the days following. Niwa says it was the city's second wettest December since records began in 1905. Photo / Murray Robertson

Wed, 08 Jan 2025 00:40:59 +0000 A sinkhole has appeared in Waitemata St in St Marys Bay, Auckland today. Photo / Michael Craig
